column4: (hopefully) quick question, is there any easy way of updating intltool? need a newer version to config the compiz extras apparently
Which version of ubuntu are you using?
It is not likely you need a newer version then.
'checking for intltool >= 0.35.0... ./configure: line 11466: intltool-update: command not found
configure: error: Your intltool is too old.  You need intltool 0.35.0 or later.
so why would it say I need to update my intltool when trying to config the compiz extras?
I appears you don't have intltool installed at all. What is the output of apt-get install intltool?
from what i was readin on the net i thought it came pre-installed, its installed now ill try again
i did look for it on the software centre but turned up nothin
Most development tools are not installed by default on ubuntu. Did you know there is a script to build compiz 0.9 and takes care of all deps and plugins for you?
I was not! will check for it now
is this to the same effect as this? http://santiance.com/2010/07/compile-compiz-0-9-0-in-ubuntu/
No it is not. He has a very old snapshot of the script there
